subject: Economics
title: The Disposition Effect: Selling Winners Too Soon
description: A quick win: understand The Disposition Effect: Selling Winners Too Soon.

hook.text: Investors are 50% more likely to sell a stock that went up than one that went down.

buildup.text: The disposition effect: investors realize gains too quickly and hold losses too long.

discovery.text: Selling winners locks in the pleasure of a gain. Holding losers avoids the pain of admitting a mistake.

twist.text: Studies show the stocks investors sold (winners) outperformed the stocks they kept (losers) by 3.4% over the next year.

climax.text: Prospect theory predicts this perfectly: risk-averse with gains (sell), risk-seeking with losses (hold).

punchline.text: We sell our flowers and water our weeds.

quiz.question: What is the disposition effect?
options: Investors sell winning stocks too early and hold losing stocks too long
